meanings.definition: A small, slender carnivorous mammal with short legs and elongated body.
meanings.sent1: The weasels in the forest are quick and agile hunters.
meanings.sent2: I saw a family of weasels playing near the riverbank.
meanings.sent3: The weasels decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was like a pack of weasels, always searching for answers.
meanings.sent5: The weasels' sleek bodies allow them to move swiftly through the undergrowth.

meanings.sent1: He weasels his way out of doing chores by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent2: She always weasels out of taking responsibility for her mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to weasels his way out of taking the test by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to weasels around the tough questions during the interview.
meanings.sent5: She managed to weasels out of attending the boring meeting by claiming she had urgent work.
